5.1.2 Differentiation Rules
In the following, we brieﬂy state basic differentiation rules, where we
denote the derivative of f by f′.
Product rule: (f(x)g(x))′= f′(x)g(x) + f(x)g′(x) (5.29)
Quotient rule:
(f(x)
g(x)
)′
= f′(x)g(x) −f(x)g′(x)
(g(x))2 (5.30)
Sum rule: (f(x) + g(x))′= f′(x) + g′(x) (5.31)
Chain rule:
(
g(f(x))
)′
= (g◦f)′(x) = g′(f(x))f′(x) (5.32)
Here, g◦f denotes function composition x↦→f(x) ↦→g(f(x)).
Example 5.5 (Chain rule)
